description: So called by Paracelsus. The first syllable may be from Ancient Greek ὀπός (opós, “vegetable juice”).

entries.meaning: (obsolete) A kind of plaster, said to have been invented by Mindererus, used for external injuries.
(obsolete) A saponaceous, camphorated liniment; a solution of soap in alcohol, with the addition of camphor and essential oils.
